meanings.sent1: The burr on the chestnut was sharp.
meanings.sent2: I picked off the burr from my sweater.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel got a burr stuck in its fur and looked quite funny.
meanings.sent4: The burr on the cactus served as a protective armor.
meanings.sent5: The burr felt like tiny needles pricking my skin.

meanings.sent1: The burr of the engine signaled its age.
meanings.sent2: The burr of the old record player was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The burr of the cat's purring was oddly comforting.
meanings.sent4: The burr of the wind through the trees was like a lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The burr of the bee buzzing nearby made me jump.

meanings.definition: A small, rough spot on a surface
meanings.sent1: The burr on the table annoyed me as I wrote.
meanings.sent2: I sanded down the burr on the wooden chair.
meanings.sent3: The burr on the glass made it look like a diamond.
meanings.sent4: The burr on the rock made it hard to sit comfortably.
meanings.sent5: The burr on the carpet snagged my socks.

meanings.definition: To make a rough, low sound
meanings.sent1: The old door would burr when opened slowly.
meanings.sent2: The wind made the branches burr against the window.
meanings.sent3: The cat would burr contentedly when petted.
meanings.sent4: The car engine began to burr softly after the tune-up.
meanings.sent5: The river burr as it flowed over the rocks.

meanings.definition: To remove something by rubbing or scraping
meanings.sent1: I had to burr off the old paint from the wall.
meanings.sent2: She used a cloth to burr away the dust on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: He tried to burr out the stain on his shirt.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to burr the burnt part of the toast.
meanings.sent5: The gardener needed to burr the weeds from the flower bed.
